paragraphs.text:
%sh

# if [[-d /tmp/ml-latest]]; then
#     rm -fr /tmp/ml-latest
#     echo "Removed existing folder"
# fi

wget -q -O /tmp/ml-latest.zip http://files.grouplens.org/datasets/movielens/ml-latest.zip
echo "Dowloaded ml-latest.zip ..."

unzip /tmp/ml-latest.zip -d /tmp/
rm /tmp/ml-latest.zip
echo "Unpacked ml-latest.zip ..."

dir0=/tmp/datalake
dir1=links
dir2=movies
dir3=ratings
dir4=tags
dir5=/user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input

for dir in $dir1 $dir2 $dir3 $dir4;do
# if [[-d $dir0/$dir]]; then
#     rm -r $dir0/$dir1
# fi
    mkdir -p $dir0/$dir
    
    mv /tmp/ml-latest/$dir.csv $dir0/$dir/
    echo "Moved $dir.csv to $dir0/$dir/ ..."
done

rm -r /tmp/ml-latest
echo "Datalake files created!"

hdfs dfs -mkdir -p $dir5
echo "Directory $dir5 created in hdfs"
hdfs dfs -put -f $dir0/$dir3/$dir3.csv $dir0/$dir2/$dir2.csv $dir5
echo "Copy $dir3.csv to hdfs://$dir5 complete"
echo "Copy $dir2.csv to hdfs://$dir5 complete"

msg.data:
Dowloaded ml-latest.zip ...
Archive:  /tmp/ml-latest.zip
   creating: /tmp/ml-latest/
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/links.csv  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/tags.csv  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/genome-tags.csv  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/ratings.csv  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/README.txt  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/genome-scores.csv  
  inflating: /tmp/ml-latest/movies.csv  
Unpacked ml-latest.zip ...
Moved links.csv to /tmp/datalake/links/ ...
Moved movies.csv to /tmp/datalake/movies/ ...
Moved ratings.csv to /tmp/datalake/ratings/ ...
Moved tags.csv to /tmp/datalake/tags/ ...
Datalake files created!
Directory /user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input created in hdfs
Copy ratings.csv to hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input complete
Copy movies.csv to hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input complete

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

# parametres

N = 5
movies_file = "hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input/movies.csv"
ratings_file = "hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input/ratings.csv"
output_dir = "hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/output"

%pyspark

movies_df = spark.read.format("csv").options(header="true", path=movies_file).load()
ratings_df = spark.read.format("csv").options(header="true").load(ratings_file)

movies_df.createOrReplaceTempView("movies")
ratings_df.createOrReplaceTempView("ratings")

%sql

create  table movies 
(movieid int, title string, genres string)
using csv
options(header=true, path="hdfs:///user/zeppelin/sparkSQL/input/movies.csv")

select * from movies limit 10

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

ratings_normalized_df = spark.sql("""
SELECT movieId, 
round(avg(rating), 2) AS avg_rating
FROM ratings 
GROUP BY movieId
-- LIMIT 10
)

%pyspark
ratings_normalized_df.show(10)

%sql
SELECT movieId, 
       round(avg(rating), 2) AS avg_rating
FROM ratings 
GROUP BY movieId
LIMIT 10

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
movies_normalized_df = spark.sql(""" 
SELECT movieId,
REGEXP_EXTRACT(title, "(.+)[ ]+[(](\\\d{4})[)]", 1) AS title,
REGEXP_EXTRACT(title, '(.+)[ ]+\\\((\\\d{4})\\\)', 2) AS year,
EXPLODE(SPLIT(genres, "[|]")) AS genre
FROM movies
-- LIMIT 10
""")
movies_normalized_df.createOrReplaceTempView("movies_normalized_df")

%pyspark
movies_normalized_df.show(10)

%sql
SELECT movieId,
       REGEXP_EXTRACT(title, "(.+)[ ]+\\\((\\\d{4})\\\)", 1) AS title,
       REGEXP_EXTRACT(title, '(.+)[ ]+\\\((\\\d{4})\\\)', 2) AS year,
       EXPLODE(SPLIT(genres, "\\\|")) AS genre
FROM movies
LIMIT 10

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
movies_nullable_title_year = spark.sql("""
SELECT movieId,
    genre,
    CASE
        WHEN ( title != "") THEN title
        ELSE NULL
    END as title,
    CASE
        WHEN ( year != "") THEN year
        ELSE NULL
    END as year
FROM movies_normalized_df
-- LIMIT 10
""")

movies_nullable_title_year.createOrReplaceTempView("movies_nullable_title_year")

%pyspark
movies_nullable_title_year.show(10)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark
joined_df = spark.sql("""
SELECT genre,
title,
year,
avg_rating
FROM movies_blanked_df
JOIN ratings_normalized_df
ON movies_blanked_df.movieId=ratings_normalized_df.movieId
-- LIMIT 10
""")
joined_df.createOrReplaceTempView("joined_df")

%pyspark
joined_df.show(10)

paragraphs.text:
%sql

create table csv_df
as
(
    SELECT *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY genre ORDER BY avg_rating DESC) AS  rank
    FROM joined_df
)

%pyspark
csv_df.show(10)

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

final_df = spark.sql("""
SELECT genre,
title,
year,
avg_rating
FROM csv_df
WHERE rank <={N}
ORDER BY genre ASC, avg_rating DESC
""").format(N)

%pyspark
final_df.show()
